articles.author: COLLEEN LONG, MAKIYA SEMINERA and MATT BROWN
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — While President Joe Biden was hosting a celebration of Black excellence at the White House with lawmakers, advocates and celebrities this past week, Kamala Harris was instead headed off to Pennsylvania.
articles.title: Harris is promoting her resume and her goals rather than race as she courts Black voters

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER and WILL WEISSERT
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Dick Cheney is a career Republican still vilified by Democrats for his bullish defense of the Iraq War as vice president.
articles.title: Dick Cheney was once vilified by Democrats. Now he's backing Harris. Will it matter?

articles.author: DAVID A. LIEB
articles.description: From the looks of it, the Phoenix suburb of Gilbert hasn’t done too much with the $24 million it received in federal pandemic aid.The site where it plans to spend most of the money for a crime victims center remains an empty plot of dirt.
articles.title: Clock is ticking for local governments to use billions of dollars of federal pandemic aid

articles.author: NASSER KARIMI and JON GAMBRELL
articles.description: TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — Iran launched a satellite into space Saturday with a rocket built by the country's paramilitary Revolutionary Guard, state-run media reported, the latest for a program the West fears helps Tehran advance its ballistic missile program.
articles.title: Iran says it successfully launched a satellite in its program criticized by West over missile fears

articles.author: ANDREW WILKS and WAFAA SHURAFA
articles.description: ISTANBUL, Turkey (AP) — A Turkish-American activist who was killed by Israeli fire in the West Bank was laid to rest on Saturday in her hometown in Turkey with thousands lining the streets and anti-Israeli feelings in the country rising from a conflict that threatens to spread across the region.
articles.title: An American activist killed by Israeli fire is buried in Turkey as Israel strikes Gaza

articles.author: JENNIFER SINCO KELLEHER and CLAUDIA LAUER
articles.description: HONOLULU (AP) — The wind pushed flames from house to house as a group of neighbors tried to escape their blazing subdivision, abandoning their cars in a blocked road and running to an industrial outbuilding for safety.
articles.title: Hawaii wildfire victims made it just blocks before becoming trapped by flames, report says

articles.author: PHILIP MARCELO
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Disgraced ex-movie mogul Harvey Weinstein faces mounting legal and health troubles some seven years after scores of women came forward with allegations of sexual misconduct against him, helping launch the global #MeToo movement.
articles.title: A look at Harvey Weinstein’s health and legal issues as he faces more criminal charges

articles.author: RODNEY MUHUMUZA
articles.description: MALINDI, Kenya (AP) — Shukran Karisa Mangi always showed up drunk at work, where he dug up the bodies of doomsday cult members buried in shallow graves.
articles.title: The church was named Good News. Hundreds of members died in a cult massacre that haunts survivors

articles.author: MARIANA MARTÍNEZ BARBA
articles.description: CHALCO, Mexico (AP) — As 56-year-old Juana Salazar Segundo walked through her home in Chalco, a low-income suburb southeast of Mexico City, she recalled how black, reeking water had reached up to her belly button after flooding early last month.
articles.title: Residents of Mexico City suburb are anxious after living over a month in black sewage water

articles.author: LEANNE ITALIE
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The cuddles. The loyalty. The worshipful eyes. There's a lot of joy in having a dog, not the least of which is heading out for a brisk walk.
articles.title: Dogs bring loads of joy but also perils on a leash
